quotes.t: You probably don't want to know how {qword}perfunctory{/qword} was the presentation of the state's evidence, how tenth-rate was the performance of the court-appointed defense or how wretched was the end.
The eight-time Pro Bowl player sometimes goes several weeks without agreeing to do even the most {qword}perfunctory{/qword} postgame interviews.
Convivial and self-absorbed, he talks freely about crime and crooks, with only the most {qword}perfunctory{/qword} nods toward conventional morality.

et: Late Latin {it}perfunctorius{/it}, from Latin {it}perfungi{/it} to accomplish, get through with, from {it}per-{/it} through + {it}fungi{/it} to perform {ma}{mat|per-|}, {mat|function|}{/ma}
shortdef: characterized by routine or superficiality : mechanical
